did.abstract: Sandi L. Wisenberg, journalist and author, was a features writer for the Miami Herald, for which she wrote "Reds: A Generation of American Radicals Fads Away on Miami Beach" (July, 21, 1985). The collection contains Wisenberg's reseach files for "Reds: A Generation of Radicals Fades Away on Miami Beach," including files labeled with the first names of the individuals featured. The files include including notebooks, drafts, clippings and other printed ephemera, and a dozen audiocassettes, principally interviews with the subjects of her article.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The collection contains Wisenberg's reseach files for "Reds: A Generation of Radicals Fades Away on Miami Beach," including files labeled with the first names of the individuals featured. The files include notebooks, drafts, clippings and other printed ephemera. There are also a dozen audiocassettes, principally interviews with the subjects of her article.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Copyright (and related rights to publicity and privacy) to materials in this collection created by Sandi L. Wisenberg are held by Sandi L. Wisenberg. Permission to publish or reproduce materials to which she holds copyright must be secured from the copyright holder. Please contact the Tamiment Library for assistance with contacting Sandi L. Wisenberg.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: Materials found in collection; provenance is unknown but was likely donated by Sandi L. Wisenberg in 2011. The accession number 2011.067 is associated with this collection.

bioghist.head: Historical/Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Sandi L. Wisenberg, journalist and author, was a features writer for the Miami Herald, for which she wrote "Reds: A Generation of American Radicals Fades Away on Miami Beach" (July, 21, 1985). Wisenberg also wrote Holocaust Girls: History, Memory and Other Obsessions (2002), and The Adventures of Cancer Bitch (2009). For more biographical information, see her website (http://slwisenberg.blogspot.com/).

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements note
phystech.p: Researchers interested in using audiovisual materials in this collection (films, cassette tapes, VHS tapes, et cetera) must use a digitized copy, which we refer to as an access copy. Researchers may view an item’s original container, but the media themselves are not available for playback because of preservation concerns. Materials that already have already been digitized are noted in the collection’s finding aid and can be requested in our reading room; materials not yet digitized will need to have access copies made before they can be used. These requests are free of charge and can be made in anticipation of your visit. The process typically takes four to six weeks. To request an access copy, or if you are unsure if an item has been digitized, please contact tamiment.wagner@library.nyu.edu with the collection name, collection number, and a description of the item(s) requested. A librarian will respond to you with further information.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection has not been arranged by an archivist. Materials are in the order in which they were received from the donor.
